item.description:
The February Meetup will be on a SUNDAY.

The Dado Tea Mass Ave location is a quiet cafe with tables and chairs that can be
pulled around, plus a big round table right in front. Since it's just about halfway between Harvard Square and Central Square, the most
convenient transportation is the #1 bus on Mass Ave. Or take the Red
Line to either Harvard or Central and walk about 10 minutes. Parking is free on Sundays in both metered spaces and residential parking.

This month's topic:
Have you ever heard people say things like "I won't eat cloned meat, it's too science-fictiony." or "This isn't like science fiction. It could really happen."
Doesn't that just burn your biscuits? But you know, they're right. A lot of science fiction is scary and/or impossible. Why is that?

The challenge:
Consider an example of a science fiction future you would or would not like to live in? Why? Does that affect how you enjoy the story?

Agenda:

4:00 Names. What do you plan to write next?

Topic: Are we too science fictiony?

5:00 Break

Open discussion.

6:00 Go Home and Write!

group.name: The Boston Science Fiction & Fantasy Writers Meetup Group

item.name: The Boston Science Fiction & Fantasy Writers February Meetup
